review_content: This is nearly perfect. I love the shade, the blendability, and the inlcuded sunscreen (why not?). On my fair skin, a couple of dots translates to a lovely sunkissed glow. I wish it weren't a liquid for easier travel, but, honestly, then it might not be as blendable.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This is absolutely everything I didn't know I needed! Trust the process! When I first got it and put the 3 dots on my cheeks (as recommended), I saw the color and I was terrified. But I started blending it with my fingers and it was such a natural, beautiful, true sun-kissed color! It looked like the natural flush I had always wanted to recreate and it stays on! It blends gorgeously on the skin and just fits your skin tone so naturally and effortless. Even my boyfriend commented on how he loved that it looked very natural and like my cheeks were just naturally flushed. I usually wear powder blushes which I personally don't like how they look on my skin and cream blushes I feel look cakey or just greasy on my oily skin. I even wear it on my no-make-up days and it such a natural beautiful look that I can't recommend it enough! Especially for girls like me who are not very skilled at make up, love to stick to one holy grail, and just don't like feeling heavy with make up. 10/10!

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Pretty shade, not worth the drawbacks
review_content:
I liked this blush when I tried it in the store, but I have run into too many issues with it after using it day to day. My biggest problem with this blush is that it doesn't build up or layer well. You have to put on the perfect amount in one go; if you go back and try to add more it just lifts off the product from underneath and ends up looking really blotchy. The same thing happens if I try to layer liquid or cream highlighter—the blush just blots right off. And as much as this product advertises itself as for a no-makeup look, I can see it sitting on my skin because it dries down to an almost powdery finish. And it doesn't last all day. The packaging is also a messy hassle. The lid was falling apart on day 1, and it gets messy quickly. I could never travel with this. I have also tried the Armani Neo blushes and prefer them. That formula gives a more watercolor effect that looks more natural and is way easier to work with. The shade 30 is similar to this blush.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I’ve used high-powered skin care all my adult life, but never makeup or primer because I could never get it on without accenting little lines and wrinkles. Now that I’m in my late 50s I’ve given up and am trying to find a better routine than just night cream and mascara. (I’ll write a separate review of the skin care products that have changed my world for the better next.) There are no cosmetic stores nearer than 80 miles from where I live, so on a recent trip I stopped in to a Sephora store for advice and to look in-person look at products. The gal who helped me there was stellar, she read my skin and what would work well immediately. First she mixed a few drops of a softener (Shiseido) with a few drops of a facial oil (Boscia), and pressed that gently over my face and neck. Then she put a little tinted primer on, then finished with 3 dabs of the No-Blush Blush (Perricone) on each cheek, blending it lightly in. The result was the very definition of a natural, healthy perfection - which is saying something for someone who is 57 and pathologically fearful of having thick or powdery makeup accent her imperfections. Now that I’ve bought got it, on busiest mornings I mix it with just my day cream and call it good, but usually I mix a little with a tinted primer (also a Sephora purchase) and it’s been going swimmingly. I LOVE it. And the price, which seemed intimidating at first, has been worth it so far, a bonus being that a little goes a long way. For bold color you’d probably want to add something, but for healthy natural glow, this is it. I’ll be checking out other Perricone products.
…read more

review_content: great color. easy to apply and not a lot needed so it lasts a long time. like the liquid blush - less drying. user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: First, it might be useful to know I am a caucasian with fair to medium skin that has a bit of a yellowish cast. This blush just blew me away. When you first begin applying it the color appears a little dark but if you blend around the edges a bit it quickly fades to an incredibly natural appearance. Although the bottle seems a little small it really does take just 3 little dots on each cheek. I love it!

user_specs: ['Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_title: Great for Natural No Makeup Looks
review_content: PROS: - Beautiful color and very natural when applied directly to moisturized / cleansed skin - very universal color - easy to travel with CONS: A bit more difficult to blend over foundation for a fuller look because the product seems to sink quickly into any liquid foundation
I like this blush. It looks so natural, and it's super easy to use. It blends well, and it's easy to build up to the perfect flush. And, I love the concept of skincare benefits in my makeup.

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content:
I like this blusher. I don't use blush very often during the daytime--especially in the summer when I'm tanned--but like to add a little highlight to the cheekbones in the evening or when my skin tone needs a little boost. A little of this blush gives a very natural highlight to the cheeks. You can also build it up by adding more. If I want a more dramatic look for night, I sometimes add a bit of Josie Maran "Illuminizer" or Cheek Gellee. A little goes a long way, so this small bottle lasts a long time.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content:
This blush gives a lovely, natural looking flush. Even though the idea of liquid blush can be intimidating, it's really easy to use: I use my finger tips in a circular motion to blend it from the apples of my cheeks up my cheek bones. Dusted with a little bronzer on top, it gives an even more beautiful effect. My only complaint is that it doesn't last all day on me - I need a refresher by the end of the work day. But I think it probably lasts better than my favorite powdered blushes - and looks way more natural as well.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content:
I've used the Perricone MD No Blush Blush for a few months and I love the results. The color is pigmented and the one shade matches my skintone throughout the seasons. I love that it also contains SPF 30 adding protection from the sun. This blush gives me glowing blushed cheeks while still benefitting the skin. I love cosmetic products that are makeup and skincare hybrids. There is very minimum smell to the product and application is very light and simple. I simply dap 2 dots on the apples of my cheeks with the applicator and then blend with my fingers. This blush is perfect for the busy and professional gal!

I found this to be absolutely wonderful! I'll wear it on its own or over foundation and it's the perfect hint of healthy color. It lasts all day, the texture is nice and application easy. You need the smallest of small amounts as a tiny touch goes a long way.

review_content: I love this product- sheer, natural, long lasting, and feels good on the skin. Perfect color... and now they discontinue it?? Why oh why?

I like this blush. It's really universal for all skin tones. I use a liquid brush to blend. If you like to use your fingers that's good too. Shake the bottle and put a few drops on a sponge or back of hand and use your favorite form of application. Lasts all day.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content: I only gave this product 4 stars because it is quite pricey. But I do love this product. I've used it maybe four times and I like how subtle it is. Nice natural glow, which is what I'm chasing. I'm not sure it's worth $35.00, but we'll see how long it lasts.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content:
This gives just the right amount of peachy-pink color, and it only takes a small amount to achieve the 'no makeup' look. It's very natural, and compares to the color of Nars Mutiple in Orgasm. It's very blendable, and I would suggest a small dab on the back of your hand, and apply from there with your finger: it really doesn't take much. If you find the color looks strange on you, it could be that you are applying too much (I tested this). This is a great option for the desired 'no makeup' look, and it is a flattering color almost everyone.

After using the No Foundation Serum from Perricone, I noticed that my powder blushes all seemed pretty chalky on top. Tried this out and I love it. It's exactly what I'm looking for with that lightweight feel & it imparts such a pretty & natural flush. A little goes a long ways so this bottle will last quite a while!

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: With my clumsy application skills, I've been using Bobbi Brown's bronzer for years, which is fool-proof and looks natural. However, with No Blush Blush, I can add a healthy glow to the apples of my cheeks without looking like a clown. I would have rated it 5 stars if the bottle didn't leak in my travel bag.
This was my first non-powder blush. The color and consistency were fine. It didn't last all day. I like the precision of powder better.
